name: Borgo di Pietrafitta Relais

reviews.text: Stayed for a week in Sept 08. Fantastic hill/ridgetop collection of stone buildings and setting and views. Spacious clean well equipped (yes - a washing machine!) 2 bd apartment. Close to Castellina and well positioned regionally for all that Tuscany has to offer. Luigi the manager had gone so we missed his (apparently) excellent individual input. We'd stay again but definitely not in an apartment due to quite intrusive noise from adjacent apartments morning and night, and lack of privacy in the outside table sitting area, but we would stay in a separate villa/house ( ...nearly all the glowing reviews are from people who stayed in these types of accomodation). The infinity pool (not heated so not used) and bbq area is nicely set out. Quite cool evenings in our stay so we got the log fire going a couple of times....10 euros a pop! Internet only via one desktop in the office...6 euros an hour! The in house wine tasting was a treat. We tried the restaurant at the driveway/entrance and found the food really good and the owner a bit of a character - if you are thin skinned go elsewhere to eat.
reviews.title: fond memories despite..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here for three nights in October. We had a one bedroom apartment with a private yard- the property is just gorgeous. Although in the summer it's probably not an issue, we did think it would be nice to have more people around. It was very quiet here! The apartment was very large and cute- my one complaint is our place was quite dark and lacking windows. It got pretty stuffy inside at night. If I were to go again with just one other person, I would probably stay at a B&B only because we found we didn't need all of the space we had! With a group of people or family, however, this property would be perfect. Lovely owners who had great suggestions for restaurants, winery tours, etc. Oh and we booked on venere.com - they had a 5% promo code which worked too!
reviews.title: Beautiful surrounds and great staff

likes.disliked: — The apartment was pretty stuffy...not many windows!

reviews.text: We visited the Chianti region to take part in the L'Eroica cycling event which departs from Gaiole. After much searching for available accommodation we found Borgo di Pietrafitta, which looked almost too good to be true. Fortunately, it lived up completely to its own website and the reviews on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Wish we stayed longer.

likes.liked: — Being a renovated old village with superb views.
likes.disliked: — Slighty remote from restuarants. A very minor problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As cyclists, it gave a great start point for riding in the region. The roads in the area are highly recommended. As tired cyclists needing sleep we found our apartment to be very quiet with little noise from the occupants below. The apartment was very well appointed and charming, we all agreed we would certainly trade it for our own apartments.
reviews.title: LOVED the romantic villa in Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, a lovely self contained village on a hilltop. We wished we had more time to spend there and that we were there in summer to enjoy the swimming pool.
reviews.title: Not quiet enough for peace and relaxation, not fun enough for a family.
This is the place you've been looking for
reviews.text: For us, this was the ideal base for exploring Chianti. The complex itself is located on a typical Tuscan hillside about a klik or two outside Castellina in Chianti.

reviews.title: wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: Other points in Chianti, Florence, Siena and San Gimignano were an easy drive away. Castellina is a charming little town in its own right with a tourist office and shops.

reviews.title: Chianti Hideaway
reviews.text: What would you call Pietrafitta -- an estate? a farm complex? an old village? It has all been expertly restored. The estate even has its own restaurant (which we didn't visit) and church (still under restoration while we were there). You do probably need a car to stay here. Pietrafitta is not in itself a village with grocery shops and so on.

reviews.title: Amazing Place!
reviews.text: The two-bedroom apartment itself was spacious, charming, comfortable and fully equipped. It was all stone and wood, and yet had all the mod cons. Modern, easy to use kitchen. Large fridge. All you need to do is buy a few groceries before you arrive.

reviews.title: This place is incredible!
reviews.text: The TV had CNN and BBC World. We went in April and it was raining, but the heating worked fine. Towels and blankets were supplied and sufficient.
Positives: friendly staff, secluded location
reviews.title: Average at best - would not return

reviews.text: Negatives: noise from other apartments, noise from outside, no private space and flies!
reviews.title: Lovely place to unwind

likes.liked: — Being on a hilltop in a private village setting.
likes.disliked: — Flies by the pool and the restaurant at the bottom of the hill.

reviews.text: Having read the previous reviews, and begun our holiday by spending three nights at a recommended apartment in Florence which lived up to expectations, we were looking forward to a relaxing stay but ended up either escaping to Castellina in Chianti - which is beautiful - or spending evenings inside with our ipods in our ears.
reviews.title: Terrific Property

likes.liked: — the pool, the view. the grounds

reviews.text: We stayed in August - which may partly explain the issues - but at the heart of it is that for famillies the only outside area other than the pool is a communal grassed area shared and surrounded by 4 or 5 apartments. Apart from the dissapointment that we did not have anywhere private outside to relax, this meant that our evenings were spent listening to the sound of a family playing volleyball outside. Fair enough, as there was nowhere else for them to go, but not relaxing for us and it reminded me of a caravan park rather than a peaceful location.
reviews.title: A Gem in Tuscany!

likes.liked: — The views and the Tuscan feeling it portrayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the apartment next door played their TV very loud (we compalned politely but the managment whilst agreeing seemed to be resigned to it) and there was banging and clattering from the adjoining apartment late into the evening which made it difficult to feel as you were "escaping" city life.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.disliked: — Rooms slightly dark due to small windows

reviews.text: We booked the accomodation here after the reviews on TripAdvisor from previous guests.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A degree of trepidation re booking on that basis was removed as soon as we arrived and saw what a wonderful location we were in. The Borgo is high on a hill and has views all around and is stunningly quiet and peaceful. We were shown to our Casa Dario room by Luigi which was great for our family of five. The apartment had two bedrooms, one of which had two bunks, and we used the sofa bed in the lounge for our third child. Three bathrooms, a smallish kitchen, lounge and dining rounded out the apartment. There was a lovely table and chairs outside the kitchen for dining when desired. Everything was immaculately clean and all furnishings etc were modern and well kept.
reviews.title: Stunning Tuscan Getaway of Your Dreams

reviews.text: The staff at the Borgo were extremely friendly, and helped us out with recommending and booking local dining options. They also organised and staged a wine and olive oil tasting of the products produced at the farmlet which was informative and well run.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Castellina in Chianti is less than five minutes drive from the Borgo and is a lovely little town. The location couldn't have been more perfect, being right in the middle of many great villages, and Siena is only about 20 minutes drive from there. As per an earlier post, make sure you eat plenty of gelato in Castellina...it really was the best we tasted in Italy.
reviews.title: beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed when the weather was very hot and this made sleeping at nights difficult as there were no fans.
reviews.title: Borgo di Pietrafitta Relais is Fantastic!

likes.disliked: — nothing...could have used a hair dryer

aka: Borgo Di Pietrafitta Relais Hotel Castellina In Chianti
description: Borgo di Pietrafitta is situated in the heart of Chianti, between Florence (48 km) and Siena (20 km), in the most beautiful part of Tuscany lying 600 m above sea level, overlooking the amazing Chianti rolling hills. All 15 apartments, recently renovated, welcome travellers to soak in the reassuring charm of tradition that the region provides. We offer you a selection of different apartments: - Small units: self-catering apartments for 2/3 people composed of a living room with fireplace and kitchenette or kitchen, 1 double room, bathroom and equipped with private garden.- Medium units: self-catering apartments for 4/5 people composed of a living room with or without fireplace, kitchenette or kitchen and two double bedrooms. Some of the apartments either offer two bathrooms or equipped private patio. - Large units: self-catering apartments for 5/6 people composed of a large living room with fireplace, kitchen, two double bedrooms, two bathrooms and equipped private garden.All apartments have a private entrance and modern facilities like SAT-TV, washing machine, dishwasher, oven, microwave oven, heating, coffee machine, telephone and fireplace (in select units). Outdoor services: infinity pool with a terrific view over the valley, a private parking place and barbecue area. Other facilities (additional charges apply): bike rental, cooking classes, Vespa tour, wine tours with driver and local wine/oil tasting.
